website_summaries.verdict: Owners who have tried the brand's other models say this middle-of-the-road option is just the right size and power. Plus, it's a bit less costly. However, it has some minor concerns.
pros: A nice-looking kitchen machine that's just a step down from Cuisinart's top model
Easy to use and not too difficult to disassemble and clean
cons: Some owners who have used it for a while notice that machine slows down when adding food during processing

customer_reviews.title: ... - EVERYTHING except cucumbers and carrots clogs - complete crap design. Red pepper - clogs
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT DICE - EVERYTHING except cucumbers and carrots clogs - complete crap design. Red pepper - clogs; tomato - forget it - it will make mush - dicer design is terrible. I only bought it because I needed a good dicer. THIS IS A TERRIBLE DISSAPOINTMENT
customer_reviews.author: A.-NJ

customer_reviews.title: bad durability of work bowl and cap
customer_reviews.text: The large work bowl and it’s cap actually broke, six months into using the product, which was shocking after paying the amount I did and carefully selecting a larger bowl to process more it has just been lying on my shelf for a year now. Dissapointed in the durability of the item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This item is good only for choping.
customer_reviews.text: This food processor made of very cheap plastic Shredder and dicing blades dont make a good job. This food processor is even worse than Hamilton Beach Professional 16 cup.
customer_reviews.author: Alinka

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly, with attachments takes up a lot of room.
customer_reviews.text: Cooks Illustrated Magazine chose this as the best food processor and I agree. Everything I have done in this unit has been completed with ease. I found the best way to clean the blades is to place them in the dishwasher as no matter how careful I am when hand-washing, I cut myself. I have yet to use all the attachments and blades and may never have the need. The unit and all the attachments take up quite a bit of room, however. I didn't see where I could purchase it with fewer attachments however.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: The slicing and shredding disks stop spinning as soon as food touches it...
customer_reviews.text: Whether it's a small block of cheese, a carrot or potato, the slicing disk and shredding disk stop spinning as soon as the food item touches it. A huge disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The plastic pushers are so flimsy, the smallest pusher broke in a month and the customer service did not even acknowledge my support email. I would have returned it but it is outside the return window. I will not suggest to buy this product at all!
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy for dicer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one for the dicing element but it is terrible would return it if possible. I love everything else but the dicer. So if like me that is why you are buying this one look elsewhere as it is constantly jamming. I’ve gone back to chopping my vegetables by hand. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: evielynn

customer_reviews.title: Too many pieces
customer_reviews.text: Very frustrated. Purchased food processor 16 months ago and the spring in the bowl handle just broke - making my machine impossible to use. Paid a lot of money for only 16 months :(
customer_reviews.author: Malka Frankel

customer_reviews.title: You need your head examined if you by the crap.
customer_reviews.text: Product leaked from day one. Called support they were clueless. Return product. I thought Cuisinart was top of the line. Instead they are💩
customer_reviews.author: CSD

customer_reviews.title: Glad we finally moved up
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for the dicer function. If you can't read 10 pages of the manual, then you should avoid the product. Very nice design. Liked the variable width slicer, which saves 6 blades. The shredder reverses for two different shreds! The dicer cuts 1 cm slices which are then forced thru the 1 cm dicer grid, with a satisfying thunk, thunk. Perfect salsa. The storage system has a place for everything. It takes less space than our 15 year old processor.
customer_reviews.author: K-Boy

customer_reviews.title: ALL THE DICING CLAIMS ARE TRUE! AND THE STORAGE KIT IS WONDERFUL!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our "new way of healthy eating" in our life meaning no meat! And we did our homework of looking everywhere and seeing what is out there and what is best for us. Cuisinart FP-13DGM Elemental 13 Cup Food Processor and Dicing Kit, Gunmetal is the best! We have had is for over a month now and it has lived up to ALL of it's claims and more! So if you are looking for a food processor for yourself or need to get a gift for a loved one this would be an AWESOME GIFT!!!! So a lot of Pro's more than I can list and NO CON'S!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: BROKEN TWICE! JUNK!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE!!!!! I have had this for less than a year and the device on the lid stopped working. That was replaced and then the blade stopped spinning completely. They refused to repair. Seriously beyond disappointed. Expensive mistake. CUISINART is JUNK!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally, one that dices
customer_reviews.text: As a chef, convenience is key for appliances at home. Besides a bigger work bowl, the dicing blade is such a treat - I don't have to rely on a prep chef, as this machine does it for me. It's quieter and more efficient that my old 11-cup model. Got to love Cuisinart for a great addition to the kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Chef Karen

customer_reviews.title: Plastic housing, cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like the plastic housing of this food processor. Looks very nice and lots of features but not sure this is going to hold up with as much as I use. Easy to move because it is so light due to the plastic, but this is not necessarily a good thing. Cuisinart appliances used to be a very well made with a great reputation but not so much anymore. For the price I expected more. Also the top to the shredder bowl has broken, going to have to order a replacement. If you order make sure you get the extended warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Meadows

customer_reviews.title: wobbling
customer_reviews.text: I have breville. I bought cuisinart because its cheaper than breville and have a dicer. Its very light weight compared to breville and wobbles when its ON. veryyy noicey. I tried carrots in dicer and its a mess to clean the blade.. huge amount remained which did not pass through dicer. I wish it worked well. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Very  disappointed item defective
customer_reviews.text: Received my food processor one day ago and the item is defective ☹️. Returning for full refund it’s not worth the hassle to reorder. So I will go to a local store and buy.
customer_reviews.author: llewis

customer_reviews.title: Worse Cuisinart in 40 years
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Cuisinart food processors for 40 years, replacing about every 6-7 years. This is the worst one I have ever owned. It's difficult to clean, almost impossible to clean the dicing attachment. The bowl and lid crack and break very easily and now, 2 years old, the motor appears to be stripped. It won't turn the attachments. I am seriously rethinking Cuisinart. What have they done to the quality ?
customer_reviews.author: katwalk

customer_reviews.title: I have enjoyed using this since I got it almost a year ...
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed using this since I got it almost a year ago. I have played with all the different blades and have found it very easy to use. I like the smaller bowl option for small things. I made pesto out of the garden all summer and it was perfect. Everything I've chopped has come out just how I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie

customer_reviews.title: Great Food Processor
customer_reviews.text: This Cuisinart food processor is great. Comes with all the extras and even has a storage bin for all the blades to sit in when not in use. It works perfectly and looks great, not to mention that it's easy to clean. A bit pricey, but well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Kim S.

customer_reviews.title: Poor product. Poorer service.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my old cuisinart mainly because this one has the dicing functionality. Food gets stuck in between the disc and blade, very hard to clean (the thing that pushes out food from the dicing blade is a joke). Seems flimsy and feels less safe compared to my old cuisinart. The storage feature for the blades was good but does not justify the price point. The price dropped by $30 the very next day after the product arrived and Amazon refused to make a price adjustment. Really? Shocked by the poor customer service. Not shocked by the price drop.
customer_reviews.author: Anya

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new Cuisinart! I replaced an older model that was still working quite well but the lid was broken I couldn’t find a replacement. I love the fact that the seal on this model prevents the liquids from escaping when filled to the top. Love my new Cuisinart! I replaced an older model that was still working quite well but the lid was broken I couldn’t find a replacement. I love the fact that the seal on this model prevents liquids or powders even from escaping when filled to the top.
customer_reviews.author: Damon P Vis

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy to use and clean. I puree peppers, onions, garlic etc. to make Spanish sofrito and I freeze it for future use. Where it would take me 8 hours to do with a blender, , I did in 2 hours with this food processor. I love it and highly recommend it. You won't be sorry..
customer_reviews.author: Rosie Carrasquillo

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and cheaply made!
customer_reviews.text: The material used is cheep plastic very thin dropped once on the counter and it chipped In 3 places. I’m afraid to use to hot of water to wash for fear it my melt. It does clean easily so you don’t need hot hot water.
customer_reviews.author: Danzig von Ramstein

customer_reviews.title: The only major downside is the lid has a russian ...
customer_reviews.text: The only major downside is the lid has a russian nesting doll design. One piece or another is always falling out. I was holding the lid and the inner piece fell out on the floor and cracked 3 pieces off of it. Bummer - it's only a few months old. It has a smaller bottom attachment - lots of attachments that are difficult to figure out. Unless you're really going to use them - get the smaller unit. The bottom is so light compared to my 10 year old KitchenAid that died - VERY pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Queervortex

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of this product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband as a birthday gift. I does not function well at all and he says his old model works so much better. the motor is loud and sluggish and the chopping feature leaves huge pieces of food stuck all over. Also, very difficult to clean. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: kirsten halloran

customer_reviews.title: I like the over all functionality of the machine
customer_reviews.text: I like the over all functionality of the machine. However, the pusher tube fell out of the lid when I was taking it off and broke when it hit the floor. The plastic is very fragile and breaks easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mary R.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for dicing
customer_reviews.text: Oh this has made my life so much easier for Thanksgiving! I used the dicing kit and i cannot be more pleased! So far so good :)
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Wished it was more sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a while now and it does the job but I would have thought it would have been...well more sturdy. When I took it out of the box, my first impressions was that it was a cheap knock off as the plastic base and some parts seems kinda......welllll cheaply made for being a Cuisinart. I was hoping for a metal base. BUT for the price I can't, or shouldn't complain much. I'll let you know in a few months how it has stood the test of time and use.
customer_reviews.author: Behrcowboy

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and multifunctional.  Cuisinart was the original and seems to deliver good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it. Lots of bits but they come with a storage box. So far she has only used about half the functions and is delighted. We also got the sprializer and she likes that especially well. Seems to be very powerful. It now has a place of honor on our too crowded kitchen counter.
customer_reviews.author: ToyBoy

customer_reviews.title: Bought a good one
customer_reviews.text: Learn the quirks and how to use before you just think its like another one you used, This one has lots of doohickey's.
customer_reviews.author: Amy B

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart quality speaks for itself. Bought this one instead of Costco for same price as this had more extras, a blade organizer and the slicer. Love the extra smaller bowl for when I am making a small batch of something and don’t need the larger one. It’s nice to have the choice in one machine rather than have to have a smaller one too.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Poor core design
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive it and equally disappointed as the primary core (for spinning blade does not rest well on its post in the center) the lid doesn’t fit when dicing system was placed. I had to return it although it took me couple hours to rebox ! I like the convenience of just turning knob to set the thickness of the slice without changing blade like most older processor. I should have gone to store and see the demonstration prior to purchasing it!
customer_reviews.author: Puffie

customer_reviews.title: Best best best I am loving this
customer_reviews.text: What can I say.. This make my plant based life so much easier.... I get to make salad all the time without expensive pre made salad... I also make homemade mayo with it.. Along with humus.. This is amazing
customer_reviews.author: Fam3��

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made model
customer_reviews.text: Within a month of first use the plastic base had cracked. While still usable, the top pieces broke and the long piece that pushes down to turn on the machine separated from the main piece rendering the machine useless. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Truitt

customer_reviews.title: Works great love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great is very quiet blades are extremely Sharp. All the features work like they should except for the dicer doesn't really work the way it's supposed to
customer_reviews.author: adam duran

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: You can cut up your veggies super quick so I love that! The con is when you shred cheese....too much of a hassle to clean after that. I see us using this for many years to come and is built to last in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: It’s worked great and saves me a lot of time.
customer_reviews.text: I really like my elemental. It’s quiet, sturdy and easy to use. Love the safety features. I watched the videos and it works beautifully!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Almost got it right this time...
customer_reviews.text: This is for the most part an excellent food processor, though it is a major nuisance in design that the flat lid cannot be attached when the 4.5 cup bowl is used (there is a plastic flange on the inner rim which prevents it). Cuisinart tech support could offer no reason for this limitation.
customer_reviews.author: GFN5

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Delivery Time!
customer_reviews.text: This unit literally took a month to get! Disappointed to say the least. I paid for it up front so for one month, I couldn’t use it!
customer_reviews.author: Shoe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great device. So much of an improvement from our original Cuisinart of 20 + years..WOW
customer_reviews.author: KLEM

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is so useful for salads and potatoes and I can just toss it in the dishwasher which is a major plus.
customer_reviews.author: Allison McGue

customer_reviews.title: Cheap bowl - MADE IN CHINA !!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the food processor, but the bowls made with cheap materials!! The handle part got broken already . When I try to replace the bowl - the bowel itself is too expensive compared to the whole machine ..
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Amazing appliance!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing power. Easy to use! So many options for use! Love this machine! I was confused on one small thing and customer support at cuisinart was amazing! Love this machine!
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Looks good in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Great quality and good looks. We still have an old white Cuisinart processor from the 70's and it still works like new! Wanted a new one to match our other Cuisinart cookware. The new one is lighter and less bulky. Can't go wrong with Cuisinart... Works great!
customer_reviews.author: IntoTheFire

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: We used this product the third time today and the spring loaded plastic piece broke rendering the food processor useless. Hopefully they can send us a replacement part.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets It Done
customer_reviews.text: Performance is excellent for all processes. Somewhat awkward learning the various devices, (took time).
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Really good food processor at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy like the older Cusinart's as we used to call them, and dice blade works great
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Comes with everything you need to chop, mince, slice, shred. Incredibly versatile food processor and very high quality for the money. I love making hummus and this processor is perfect for that.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Rabbeni

customer_reviews.title: and actually she is very happy having the dicing attachment
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my wife to replace a different food processor that had broke. No complaints at all, and actually she is very happy having the dicing attachment. Hope this one lasts as long as our old one.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Little

customer_reviews.title: The processor works well, but the instruction booklet that ...
customer_reviews.text: The processor works well, but the instruction booklet that comes with the unit is a piece of near-worthless junk. Undefined terms with little or no helpful visual reference. I learned more from playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Fionnbharr

customer_reviews.title: this is to replace our original Cuisinart Food Processor, ...
customer_reviews.text: this is to replace our original Cuisinart Food Processor, that was over 30 years old. It was time for a new one. Not sure I will use all the capabilities but looking forward to trying them. Lighter weight than the old one which makes it easier to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am still more than satisfied withe the processor itself
customer_reviews.text: The dicing kit wasn't the quality I was expecting from Cuisinart. I am still more than satisfied withe the processor itself. Having the different sized work bowls is great as is the adjustable slicing disc.This is the third Cuisinart I've owned over the years and would recommend them very highly.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Tennell

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart has great products for price
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Had a Cuisinart food processor for years. Still use old one but this one is awesome. Love Cuisinart products.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Ann Westcott

customer_reviews.title: The product is fine......but~~
customer_reviews.text: The Cuisinart food processor came to me with a terribly torn up box. Upon further examination, there was no Styrofoam inserts, as the booklet said were supposed to be there. This leads me to believe that it isn't a new product. These factors are displeasing. So, basically...all components had traveled willy nilly to me. A few minor scrapes, but is this good business practice?
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful food processor with such an array of attachments. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Roddy Acon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This particular machine is incredible. I have bought an earlier model and Cuisinart puts out a very excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value for most homes
customer_reviews.text: Dicer nice feature but not getting expected results. Handles any other job extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Janny M

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: This arrived damaged. I’m not sure if I am going to keep it. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Loraine

customer_reviews.title: Motor stopped working after only a few months
customer_reviews.text: Motor has stopped working. Although it is under warranty, the process (and costs I need to cover to return the item) is more than I am interested in shouldering.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and has all the attachments you need! Great product, I love to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Bourland

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs one!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my daughter as a Christmas....jealous that mine isn’t as nice. Comes with a case to store the blades. She said it is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: The dicing attachment is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love the machine. It's fast and does the job precise. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Fab Soto

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this food processor!!! I use it a lot in my healthy cooking, most frequently when making homemade peanut butter. But every recipe I've made with it has turned out great!
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Levin

customer_reviews.title: Who needs a sou chef...not me!
customer_reviews.text: The package was received a bit banged up, even the original but, no harm to contents. It is a great machine, plenty of power, does what it is supposed to do, and quite simple to clean and maintain. A gift for my wife, while I get the benefits of great food preparation.
customer_reviews.author: GandyDancer

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen asset!
customer_reviews.text: Great and used 3 times a week minimum. Works great for spiralizing zucchini and squash.
customer_reviews.author: Candace Bryant

customer_reviews.title: The new one an excellent product like the old one
customer_reviews.text: The old one says no more. The new one an excellent product like the old one. Great choice
customer_reviews.author: Miguel A. Formosa

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine, but difficult to clean central spinning mechanism. Food goes in cavity but no easy way to get it out! Returned it since this was a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence W. Keeton

customer_reviews.title: Skip buttons, go for paddles.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t use this more than once. I felt like I was straining to press the buttons. The food processors with the paddles are SO MUCH EASIER.
customer_reviews.author: S and C

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I ever made worth every penny!! Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: Very nice food processor! We love to cook and had wanted one for a long time. The attachments work great!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth J.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great food processor. I use it daily. Very easy to use. I hand wash to extend the life. Comes with convenient case for blades. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Valphd2015

customer_reviews.title: Love this food processor
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a birthday gift and absolutely love it. I’m able to hide veggies in my meals from the picky kids lol
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: My first one. Need to read and figure out all it does
customer_reviews.author: SANDY YOUNG

customer_reviews.title: Buy if you need a dicer
customer_reviews.text: Good buy. But a lot of food goes waste while dicing.
customer_reviews.author: KN

customer_reviews.title: Best money I've spent in a long time
customer_reviews.text: Being on the Keto lifestyle, this thing is extremely helpful. It's so much easier to make cauliflower rice and casserole. It shreds cheese so fast. It came with all of the accessories and a case to hold them. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: lory

customer_reviews.title: THE WORST!
customer_reviews.text: Awful, do not buy! Crapped out after about 8-10 uses and Amazon has yet to reply to my inquiries about replacing it (of course). I couldn't be more disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Ed

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this! So many attachments, locking case for the extra blades, my new favorite kitchen gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My wife loved it and said it did everything and more.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Riedel

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart 13 cup food processor.
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!! This machine does it all and very well. I don't know what I did before I got this. Family bought it for me for my birthday. one of my all time favorite gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: This model is big and more importantly not easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I consider a food processor an important tool for the kitchen. I use it often and have burned through 2 in the past 7 years. Prior to this model I had the "classic" which have a smaller cup capacity. This model is big and more importantly not easy to clean. Makes me think twice about using it
customer_reviews.author: John P Hovnanian

customer_reviews.title: Every cook should have one in there kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Great machine, makes cooking recipes so much easier for me and my wife
customer_reviews.author: Warren David Thorp

customer_reviews.title: The food processor functions well. However, the feed ...
customer_reviews.text: The food processor functions well. However, the feed chute and lid broke after it fell down from the kitchen countertop . Also, the replacement parts are not yet available from cuisinart as the it's a new food processor model
customer_reviews.author: HKA

customer_reviews.title: disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Turned on the food processor and it didn't power on. Have to return it, disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT DICE SWEET POTATOES
customer_reviews.text: This is a POS for a few reasons. First, it is the NOISIEST food processor I have ever experienced in many years on this earth. Second, I specifically wanted to be able to dice potatoes and was excited about that option. On the second attempt the top got wedged on and I could barely get it off. I figured I would give it another try, guess what???? I CAN NOT GET THE top off, it is STUCK. If you just want to chop veggies it is fine, but no way is this going to dice sweet potatoes. Huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to assemble so that it functions well
customer_reviews.text: Have had this brand of food processor for many years; decided to try the "new" version, complete with two bowl system and dicing kit. Glad I purchased it before the Chinese tariffs went into effect! The YouTube videos help with assembly and use. Fitting the pieces together so that it functions (even turns on) isn't straightforward. Although it "dices" efficiently, the resulting pieces are too small. The cheese grating wheels (reversible for course and fine shred) work better. Now regretting I took my old Cuisinart to the charity shop!
customer_reviews.author: KRITIKOS

customer_reviews.title: Totally useless
customer_reviews.text: Loud (like it hurts my ears and likely is damaging my hearing to be in the same room loud), way too many pieces, confusing and not intuitive in any way, does not do a good job (dough just sits on the side of the bowl in a sticky mess).....and motor burned out the fifth time I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Camus

customer_reviews.title: Created to much waste, and more . . .
customer_reviews.text: After really putting it through it’s paces, I ended up returning it. It has great power, but there is too much waste from food not being processed all the way due to a gap between the chute and the blades. I also had to cut the food way down to fit in the chute so that the pusher would actually engage the machine. Clean up was no fun, either.
customer_reviews.author: Julie D. Whitney

customer_reviews.title: cheap material. Bowls break too easy
customer_reviews.text: it works ok, but not satisfied with chopping blade, does not do good job. haven't even tried the dicer. Also I dropped the small bowl and it broke! I have never dropped a piece like that and a piece shatter off. Now they tell me I have to buy a new one because I dropped it. It is made of very cheap material. I would not buy it again. The warranty doesn't cover their cheaply made parts if they break. I never even got to use the small bow.
customer_reviews.author: Dell Marion

customer_reviews.title: BROKE FIRST USE
customer_reviews.text: Jammed when dicing vegetables. Yes, I cut them down, yes I was using the unit properly. When I tried to take the lid off to unjam it, the plastic handle ripped off (no I am not that strong). Now I have to toss the unit and the vegetables left in the bowl because I can't even get the bowl to detach.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Not worthy of the Cuisinart Name!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this food processor but returned it after trying it in different modes. The new features - the way to attach blades, the smaller bowls, the fiendishly difficult insertion of slicing and grating blades made this machine a loser. It is also very flimsy in comparison to other models I have owned. My 12 year old machine was much easier to clean, chopped better, and sliced perfectly. I wanted a larger capacity for the bowl and this machine seemed like a great deal. Not so! While I like Cuisinart products stay away from this model.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna M. Forman

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy garbage !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Second time using this and stopped working , my return Winslow is closed . Horrible customer service waited on hold for half hour only to find no one to help . Very disappointed, what can you expect made in China , I will only buy American made products from now on . USA only , I am willing to pay the extra money to buy American products........ update it is now two months later can’t get ahold of anyone in customer service NA I have emailed them several times giving them my tracking number they always reply with nonsense asking for other numbers . Do not buy this product you will be at a loss of 145.00
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: This is my new best friend in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This is my new best friend in the kitchen. I'm a Whole30 lifestyler and this makes life fun! All of the options make working in the kitchen an adventure. Lightweight and sturdy at the same time! Worth the $$.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Weber

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I’d hoped
customer_reviews.text: The downside is that a piece broke within six weeks of purchase. Granted, I dropped the piece while washing, but I would not expect the plastic to so easily break. All of the plastic pieces seem a lint thin...Until this happened I was in love. Now to go online and search and see if the piece is replaceable.
customer_reviews.author: VGM

customer_reviews.title: It’s A Large Unit. Very Capable To Do Most Every Need.
customer_reviews.text: This is a large unit. It’s what we wanted. In my opinion it is not for daily use for unless you cook and freeze meals. Very sturdy. Rinse clean then put in soapy water for a few minutes. Then just clean off any stuck on food. We put the parts in the dishwasher. Not sure if really dishwasher safe. No heat drying. We use the unit for parties and family get togethers. Because there is some time between uses we have to re-familiarize ourselves with which part goes where. There is an abundance of parts and accessories that come with it. Make sure you buy the unit that comes with the storage case.
customer_reviews.author: PinetreeCC

customer_reviews.title: It has the same build quality issues as the other ...
customer_reviews.text: It has the same build quality issues as the other cuisinart elemental food processors. First time I used it the lid jammed and the handle cracked while trying to unscrew the top. Wasn't able to remove the top soI'm returning the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul Bhandari

customer_reviews.title: Love the updates and sealed work bowl!
customer_reviews.text: This replaces my 10 cup food processor. I LOVE the sealed bowl as it keeps things from running out of the hole around the blade when you remove the work bowl after processing. Very helpful when I make large batches of chai latte mix. I love every feature and it’s a real improvement over my previous Cuisinart processor.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Great at Spirals
customer_reviews.text: So far only have played with the Spiral attachment. And i must say it was impressed. It works great. just need to make sure your cut off end of what every veggie straight or it will topple and mess up. I made some Potatoes and some carrots which were a little harder than the potatoes because of the thickness but my parrots love them as edible toys
customer_reviews.author: Elsa

customer_reviews.title: Reputable brand Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with purchase! I wanted to purchase a food processor for quite some time and glad I invested in a reputable brand. Use it the same day I opened it, will definitely get much use in the future also. Excited to try the dicing kit it comes with. Comes with lots of other attachments in a nice protective container with a lock also
customer_reviews.author: kelli thompson

customer_reviews.title: Seemed to work as advertised until the bowl cover got ...
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work as advertised until the bowl cover got jammed and the handle snapped off in my hand. I promise just a little pressure. Very cheaply made plastic bowl handle. When I called Cuisinart for a replacement. Guess what? Right! Out of stock. Of course, (they snap at the drop of a hat) out of stock on such a cheap handle bowl. "back-ordered" no arrival time! Avoid the headache. Just my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: Extremely well designed
customer_reviews.text: Everything works well together. The design is perfect, everything fits together and works seamlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Wagonwheel 3.14149

product_meta.title: Cuisinart FP-13DGM Elemental 13 Cup Food Processor and Dicing Kit, Gunmetal
product_meta.description: Color:GunmetalTackle food prep tasks both large and small with the Cuisinart Elemental 13 Food Processor. The NEW dicing disc features a 10mm screen for dicing food into perfect squares and we've also included a cleaning tool to keep it in top operating condition. The 13-cup work bowl easily handles larger quantities of ingredients, making it perfect for big family meals and entertaining - the bonus 4 cup bowl is ideal for smaller amounts. Two stainless steel blades and two discs make quick work of chopping nuts, pureeing soup, slicing tomatoes, shredding cheese and more. The high gloss base adds high style to any kitchen. Features: 13 cup large work bowl and 4 cup smaller inner nested work bowl|550 watt peak power motor|Exclusive patent-pending SealTight Advantage System — seals bowl and locks blade|Supreme||wide-mouth feed tube with small medium and large pushers|Dicing disc with 10mm grid plus cleaning tool|Stainless steel chopping/mixing blade with patented BladeLock system including dough blade and small and large S-blades|Stainless steel reversible shredding disc (fine/medium)|Stainless steel adjustable slicing disc (0-7mm)|Electronic touchpad controls—High/Low/Off/Pulse with illuminating blue LED lights|Accessory storage case|Limited 3-year warranty|BPA free
feature_bullets: Dicing disc with 10 mm grid plus cleaning tool
Exclusive patent-pending SealTight Advantage system - seals bowl and locks blade
Easy to clean - removable parts are dishwasher safe
Troubleshooting steps are provide in page 15 and 16 of User Manual available under Technical Specification
13-cup large bowl, the exterior of the work bowl only measure up-to only 8 Cups but has a 13 cup capacity, 4.5-cup small bowl
